Academic Office Program Application.title: review
Academic Office Program Application.question: What are the main issues to be addressed in the review?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: The focus of the review is mainly to solve important key issues, the degree of innovation, the degree of expected impact and international competitiveness.

Academic Office Program Application.title: review
Academic Office Program Application.question: How to evaluate the degree of innovation and international competitiveness?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: The evaluation of the degree of innovation and international competitiveness is mainly through the written review of experts in the project field, and then through three stages of review and final review. During this process, the review committee will conduct discussion and evaluation based on the performance of various projects and the similarity of themes, together with the views of Academia Sinica, to ensure the fairness and effectiveness of the evaluation.

Academic Office Program Application.title: review
Academic Office Program Application.question: How is the review job divided into three phases?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: The review operation is divided into three stages. Firstly, experts in the planning field conduct a written review, then enter the re-examination stage, and finally conduct a final review.

Academic Office Program Application.title: review
Academic Office Program Application.question: Under the new system, how are various research projects evaluated by the three academic committees?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: Under the new system, various research projects are discussed and evaluated by the review committees of the three academic groups of mathematical sciences, life sciences, and humanities and social sciences, and decisions are made based on the views of Academia Sinica. This approach helps to fully consider the level of each application and the similarity of themes, making the funding more fair and effective.

Academic Office Program Application.title: review
Academic Office Program Application.question: How does this review method ensure the fairness and effectiveness of grants?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: This review method mainly passes through three stages: written review, review and final review to ensure the fairness and effectiveness of financial subsidies. First, experts conduct a written review of the plan. Then, various projects in the same field will be submitted to the review committees of the three academic groups of mathematical sciences, life sciences, humanities and social sciences for evaluation. In the end, Academia Sinica will make decisions based on these scoring results and its own opinions. This approach allows the entire review process to more fully take into account the quality and topical similarity of each application, thereby ensuring that funding is more fair and effective.

Academic Office Program Application.title: implement
Academic Office Program Application.question: How does Academia Sinica allocate funds according to different project types?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: When the Academia Sinica allocates funds, it will arrange according to the type of the project, whether it is individual or team integration, the scale and depth of the project, and benefit evaluation and other factors. They will rigorously plan allocations with reference to past experience and analytical reviews, while incorporating and revising results from relevant practical research for program review. In addition, they will also carry out follow-up management and assessment operations such as mid-term report review, implementation of expiry report evaluation, plan changes, and funding control. Each plan has a mechanism for rolling adjustments to the subsidy amount to ensure optimal operation. benefit.

Academic Office Program Application.title: implement
Academic Office Program Application.question: How does the rolling grant amount mechanism for these research programs work?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: The rolling adjustment subsidy amount mechanism of these research projects is based on the progress and results of the projects, and continues to carry out follow-up and evaluation operations such as mid-term report review, implementation report evaluation, project changes, and funding control. After evaluation, the subsidy amount will be adjusted according to the actual situation of the project to achieve the best operational efficiency.

Academic Office Program Application.question: What are the application and review procedures for the Deep Cultivation Program of Academia Sinica?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: The application and review procedures for the Deep Cultivation Program of Academia Sinica are very strict. After application, recommendation and review, candidates can receive five years of research funding support.

Academic Office Program Application.question: How to select the most forward-looking and representative research topics for the theme research plan?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: The theme research plan will select forward-looking and representative research topics in the three major fields of mathematical sciences, life sciences, and humanities and social sciences. Their goal is to develop creative and breakthrough research results to make world-class important contributions in the field of basic research.

Academic Office Program Application.title: implement
Academic Office Program Application.question: How does the Key Breakthrough Program select key academic issues that are in line with Academia Sinica and the country's social development?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: The Key Breakthrough Program will carefully select key academic issues that are in line with the development of Academia Sinica and the country and society. These issues usually have the courage to challenge and break through existing bottlenecks, such as gene and cell therapy, data science, air pollution, quantum technology, etc. During the selection process, we hope to find research projects that have the potential to solve important scientific and social problems, and fulfill the duties of the country's top research institutions and scientists.

Academic Office Program Application.question: What important scientific and social questions do these research programs hope to address in the future?
Academic Office Program Application.answer: The important scientific and social issues that these research projects hope to solve in the future include gene and cell therapy, data science, air pollution, quantum technology, future society, social investigation of totalitarian regimes, major diseases and precision medicine, agricultural biotechnology and health and longevity, etc. field challenges. These studies can not only help us overcome the current difficulties we are facing, but also allow us to fulfill the duties of the country's top research institutions and scientists.

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Sustainable Science Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: What are the key sustainability issues to be addressed in this sustainability science research project?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The key sustainable issues to be solved by this sustainable scientific research plan are the following six directions: 1. Energy and carbon reduction technology, 2. Food, air, water protection and security, 3. Transformation towards a sustainable society , 4. Health well-being and environmental change, 5. Earth system under global change, and 6. Disaster prevention, mitigation and recovery.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Sustainable Science Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: How to invite outside scholars to join the research team?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: To invite outsiders to join the research team, you can communicate with experts in fields related to the annual theme during the plan solicitation period, introduce the project content and goals to them, and ask them about their willingness to participate in joint research. If the conditions are suitable, they can be invited to join the team to jointly develop the project application. During the implementation of the plan, if you want to invite scholars outside the academy to join the research team, it will be considered as a change in the plan and must be reported to Academia Sinica for approval.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Sustainable Science Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: What are the specific contents of the six directions promoted by sustainable research?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The six directions promoted by sustainable research include: 1. Energy and carbon reduction technology, 2. Protection and safety of food, air, and water resources, 3. Transformation towards a sustainable society, 4. Health and well-being and environmental change, 5 . Earth System under Global Change, and 6. Disaster Prevention, Mitigation and Recovery.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Sustainable Science Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: What types of solicitations are there for this program?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: There are two main types of solicitation for this plan, namely: 1. Three-year integrated and single-integrated plan (the subject of solicitation is announced regularly every year). 2. Promote active planning (Top-down) plans from time to time (in principle, the implementation period is within 1 year).
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Sustainable Science Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: Is the plan briefing held in late April every year?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: Yes, every year in late April, a project solicitation briefing will be held.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Sustainable Science Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: The deadline for program applications is the end of June every year, right?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: That's right, the deadline for program applications is late June each year (about the end of the month).
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Sustainable Science Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: Is the approved plan usually announced in November and then implemented in January of the following year?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: Yes, approved programs are usually announced in November and then implemented in January of the following year.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Sustainable Science Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: What is the funding limit for this integrated sustainable science program?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: This integrated sustainable science project does not have a clear upper limit for funding applications, but the principle is that the total funding for the project should not exceed NT$20 million.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Sustainable Science Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: How to determine reasonable implementation funds?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: Reasonable implementation costs are determined by consensus at the review meeting. Appropriate funding will be approved at the review meeting based on the theme and scale of cooperation of each project. However, in principle, the total project funding should not exceed 20 million yuan.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Sustainable Science Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: Where can I find more detailed instructions on the overall promotion of the Sustainable Science Project?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: You can find more details about the overall promotion of the Sustainable Science Project at this website: http://www.cfss.sinica.edu.tw/.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: mission-oriented biotechnology research project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: Which teams with specific R&D experience will this task-oriented biotechnology research project help?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: This mission-oriented biotechnology research project is mainly to help teams with experience in the development of small molecule drugs, antibody drugs, nucleic acid drugs, nano drugs, cell therapy and medical materials.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: mission-oriented biotechnology research project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: Which six major biomedical fields does this plan mainly focus on?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: This program mainly conducts research on six major biomedical fields: precision medicine/cancer treatment, infectious diseases, neurodegenerative diseases, metabolic diseases, innovative medical applications and innovative detection technologies.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: mission-oriented biotechnology research project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: How long is the ultimate goal of the project to turn the research results into commercially valuable product technologies?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The ultimate goal of the project is to turn research results into commercially valuable product technologies within 3 to 5 years.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: mission-oriented biotechnology research project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: Plans that pass the review can be stationed in the National Biotechnology Research Park for implementation, so what support and resources will the park provide?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The National Biotechnology Research Park has various experimental spaces for the translation team to settle in, and assists the translation team to conduct value-added experiments through world-class core facilities. At the same time, combining the regular forums, educational training, speeches and other activities held by the Academy of National Biotechnology Research Park, as well as resources such as patents, competitors and market databases, can improve the business thinking and skills of the translation team and cultivate biotechnology and medical entrepreneurial talents. You can refer to the official website (https://nbrp.sinica.edu.tw/) for more detailed information.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: mission-oriented biotechnology research project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: When is the approximate time of application each year?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The application period is approximately between April and July each year.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: mission-oriented biotechnology research project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: In which month is the deadline for proposal submission?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The deadline for proposal submissions is mid-July.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: mission-oriented biotechnology research project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: The review process goes through several stages. In which month will the applications that pass the review be announced?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The review process has gone through three stages: written preliminary review, committee review and joint final review meeting. Approved applications are usually announced in November.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: mission-oriented biotechnology research project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: In what month does the approved plan that has passed the review generally start to be implemented?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: Approved plans that pass the review will generally be implemented in January of the following year.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: mission-oriented biotechnology research project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: How many years is the implementation time principle of this plan?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The principle of implementation time for this plan is 3-5 years.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: mission-oriented biotechnology research project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: The principle of implementation time of this plan is 3-5 years, so how is the amount of funding determined according to the demand? Will there be a cap?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The amount of funding for this project is determined according to the needs of each research team, that is to say, it will be arranged according to the research plan and budget proposed by the team.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Response to Epidemic Research Program
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: What exactly does this epidemic response research plan do?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: This epidemic response research plan is mainly to integrate the research capabilities of infectious diseases in the hospital, so that different units can cooperate in the research and development of detection technology, drugs, antibodies, vaccines and pathogenic mechanisms. It will also provide interdisciplinary laboratory support and use various related resources to establish a complete epidemiological research and development environment to enhance overall research capabilities. The plan hopes to establish a key technology platform and drug resource library for the prevention and treatment of infectious diseases. In the future, if faced with an outbreak of emerging infectious diseases, rapid screening reagents, antibody drugs, specific drugs and vaccines can be developed in the shortest possible time and quickly provided. Clinical trials and commercialization for industry. These research results will also be stored in the National Research Park, which serves as an important national resource bank for the prevention and control of emerging infectious diseases.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Response to Epidemic Research Program
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: What interdisciplinary laboratory support does the project involve?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The interdisciplinary laboratory support provided by this project includes related resources such as molecular structure, antibody development, animal models and P3 laboratories.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Response to Epidemic Research Program
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: How does this plan shorten the time to develop rapid screening reagents, antibody drugs and vaccines?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: This plan gathers the infectious disease research capacity in the hospital and cooperates with various units to invest in the research and development of detection technology, drugs, antibodies, vaccines and pathogenic mechanisms. At the same time, it provides cross-field laboratory support and related resources, such as molecular structure, antibody research and development, animal models and P3 laboratories, etc., and is expected to accelerate the development of rapid screening reagent prototypes, antibody drugs and vaccines and other products. In this way, these products can be quickly provided to the industry for use in the event of an outbreak of an emerging infectious disease, shortening the development time.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Response to Epidemic Research Program
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: When is the deadline to apply for this program?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The time to apply for this program is from April to July each year, first submit the letter of intent in mid-May, and then submit the plan in mid-July.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Response to Epidemic Research Program
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: What is the project execution time and funding amount?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: In principle, the implementation time of the plan is 4 years, and the maximum amount of funding per year is NT$20 million.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Digital Humanities Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: [Digital Humanities Research Project] is promoted by which unit of Academia Sinica?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The Digital Humanities Research Program is promoted by the Digital Culture Center of Academia Sinica.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Digital Humanities Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: What is the purpose of promoting [Digital Humanities Research Project]? What are the core jobs?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: The Digital Humanities Research Initiative aims to assist in the digital turn of humanities research. The core tasks include building a digital humanities knowledge base, fostering innovative research in digital humanities, developing and using digital humanities research tools, publishing academic works and displaying humanities research results in multiple ways.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Digital Humanities Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: What is the planned process and direction of the [Digital Humanities Research Project]?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: Based on academic research, the Digital Culture Center integrates various digital cultural assets, continuously enriches digital content, improves the digital humanities research environment, guides the public to participate, and shares digital knowledge. Cross-domain integration and communication.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Digital Humanities Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: Does the [Digital Humanities Research Project] interact with other related fields around the world?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: Yes, the Digital Culture Center not only participates in international seminars in the field of digital humanities every year, but also establishes different communication and cooperation modes with important relevant units around the world.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Digital Humanities Research Project
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: Where can I find out more [Digital Humanities Research Project]?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: For more details about [Digital Humanities Research Program], you can directly refer to https://ascdc.sinica.edu.tw/.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: How does this core facility and innovative instrument project enhance the research capability and competitiveness of Academia Sinica?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: This plan aims to enhance the research capabilities and competitiveness of Academia Sinica by enriching and effectively utilizing existing research resources, improving the service quality and efficiency of core facilities, and encouraging the development of innovative research instruments. This will help improve research standards, strengthen international standards, and promote domestic scientific and technological innovation and economic development.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: How to improve the service quality and efficiency of core facilities?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: To improve the service quality and efficiency of core facilities, existing research resources can be enriched and effectively used, and research and development of new research instruments can be encouraged. In addition, professional training can also be carried out to improve the maintenance level of facilities, enhance special functions and support special research and technology development.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: What documents do I need to submit to apply for this program?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: To apply for this program, you need to submit a research proposal, personal resume, and a list of major works in recent years.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: Which research facilities or instruments are eligible for grant recipients?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: Research facilities or instruments that meet the requirements of the subsidy include: 1. Conforming to the key research directions of Academia Sinica, such as genomics, proteomics, metabolomics and other popular topics related to life sciences; 2. Multi-unit or interdisciplinary research of Academia Sinica Facilities with common needs; 3. Research facilities or instruments that require the assistance of professionals to conduct experiments; 4. Research facilities or instruments used to develop special research technologies or improve the special functions of equipment.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application - Ty.title: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.question: How does this plan help to promote technological innovation and economic development in the country?
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.answer: This plan helps to promote domestic scientific and technological innovation and economic development, mainly by improving the research capabilities and competitiveness of Academia Sinica. This will enable Academia Sinica to have a higher research level in the fields of genomics, proteomics, metabolomics and other life sciences. In addition, providing advanced research facilities and instruments so that different units or cross-field research teams can use them together will help promote domestic technological innovation and economic development.
Academic Office Program Application - Ty.category: Academic Office Program Application - Type III Program

Academic Office Program Application Form.question: How can I participate in this program?
Academic Office Program Application Form.answer: To participate in this program, you must first be a full-time assistant researcher, a non-permanent research fellow of Academia Sinica, or a newly recruited research assistant or non-permanent associate researcher at various research institutes and research centers of Academia Sinica. Next, apply during the period from March to May each year, submit the letter of intent in early April, and then ask the recommending unit to submit the paper plan information in early May. After that, it is time to wait for the written preliminary review, re-examination and final review process. In November, the applications that pass the review will be announced, and the plans that pass the review will be implemented in January of the following year. Remember to prepare a research proposal, personal resume and catalog of major works, as well as letters of recommendation and relevant meeting minutes when applying. For more information and how to apply, please visit the relevant website of Academia Sinica.

Academic Office Program Application Form.title: Critical Breakthrough Seed Program
Academic Office Program Application Form.question: How do I apply for the Critical Breakthrough Program?
Academic Office Program Application Form.answer: To apply for the Key Breakthrough Program, you need to log in to the Academia Sinica academic service management system https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/, and prepare the following documents within the application period: research proposal, personal resume and major works in recent years Table of contents. There are two tiers of application each year, the first tier application period is from January to March, and the second tier application period is from July to September. The application then goes through a three-stage review. The plans approved in the first tier will be implemented in July of the same year, and the plans approved in the second tier will be implemented in January of the following year. For details on the application, please refer to the "Academia Sinica Key Breakthrough Program Operation Key Points", and related information can be found at https://www.sinica.edu.tw/ch/articles/425.

Academic Office Program Application Form.title: Critical Breakthrough Seed Program
Academic Office Program Application Form.question: What is the difference between the Critical Breakthrough Seed Program and the Critical Breakthrough Research Program?
Academic Office Program Application Form.answer: The main difference between the Critical Breakthrough Seed Program and the Critical Breakthrough Research Program is the program duration and research phase. The term of the seed project is 1 to 2 years, which is suitable for the research that is still in the embryonic stage of the concept, which has originality and development potential; while the period of the key breakthrough research project is 5 years, which is suitable for the research with a more specific concept and a relatively mature research program.

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Is this core facility construction plan intended for use by the whole hospital?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the goal of this core facility construction plan is to build new core facilities and make them available to everyone in the hospital.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Can only those who are full-time research assistants or full-time research assistants or above in Academia Sinica apply for this program?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, only those who are full-time research assistants or above and full-time research assistants or above at Academia Sinica can apply for this program.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Can the project period be up to 5 years?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the program duration can be up to 5 years.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: If I want to continue the plan, do I have to apply in the last year before the plan expires?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, if you want to continue the program, you must apply in the last year before the program expires.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: The application should detail the funding, equipment, personnel and resource requirements as well as the project goals, methods and expected results, right?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the application should detail the required funds, equipment, personnel and other resources, as well as describe the goals, methods and expected results of the project.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Do I have to provide an estimated timeline and progress statement when I submit my application?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, an estimated timeline and progress statement is required with the application.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Do we need to provide a method and standard for evaluating the progress and results of the project, as well as the expected contribution and application value?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, you need to provide a method and standard for evaluating the progress and results of the project in the application, and explain the expected contribution and application value.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Does the core facility maintenance plan allow all colleagues in the hospital to use shared research facilities?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the purpose of the core facility maintenance plan is to allow applicants to provide the shared research facilities established by each institute for the use of colleagues in the whole hospital.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Can the duration of the project be 1 to 5 years?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the duration of the project can be 1 to 5 years.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How to extend the project period, is it necessary to submit the application for the next term one year before the end of the project?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, if you want to extend the duration of the program, you can submit the application for the next term one year before the end of the program.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: What detailed plans should the application include, such as equipment, service content, charging prices, etc.?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: The application should include equipment, service content, charging price, and also need to explain the procedures and rules for using and booking equipment. In addition, it is also necessary to provide the expected benefit and contribution plan of the shared facilities, describe the existing usage and operation status, evaluation methods and standards, and the expected contribution and application value. At the same time, the expansion and renewal of shared facilities will also need to be discussed to ensure compliance with research needs and technological developments.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: What about procedures and rules for using and reserving equipment?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: To explain the procedures and rules for using and reserving equipment, you can first introduce how to apply for and reserve equipment online, as well as the basic information and contact information that users need to provide. Next, explain how to ensure the availability of the equipment when making an appointment, and how the user can use the equipment within the specified time. Finally, remind users to abide by relevant regulations, such as caring for equipment, returning it on time, etc., to ensure a good use experience and environment.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Is it necessary to describe the current status and operation of the shared facilities in the application?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the application needs to describe the current status and operation of the shared facilities.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How should the applicant provide the methods and criteria for evaluating the progress and results of the project?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: In the application, the applicant needs to describe the methods and standards for evaluating the progress and results of the project. This may include setting clear goals, desired outcomes and timelines, as well as indicators or criteria by which to measure outcomes. The applicant should also suggest how to adjust the plan and standards according to the actual situation to ensure smooth progress.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How to describe the expected contribution and application value?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: To describe the expected contribution and application value, you can explain in the application that this project will help researchers and laboratories, such as providing more convenient and efficient instruments and equipment, so that researchers can more easily conduct experiments and Research. In addition, it is possible to explain how this common facility promotes academic exchange and collaboration, and what positive impact it has on research and technology development in related fields. Finally, the possibilities brought about by facility upgrades and expansions can also be emphasized to maintain Academia Sinica's advantage in research competition.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How to ensure that shared facilities can keep up with research needs and technological developments to expand and update?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: To ensure that shared facilities can keep up with the expansion and renewal of research needs and technological developments, applicants should discuss plans for expansion and renewal of shared facilities in their applications. This ensures that shared facilities remain in line with research needs and technological developments.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Innovative Instrument Development Project
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Is this innovative instrument development type project helping research instrumentation advance?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: That's right, the innovative instrument development plan is to develop new research instruments or facilities, and then set them up as core facilities for use by colleagues in Academia Sinica.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Innovative Instrument Development Project
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Is the qualification to apply for this program limited to full-time research assistants or full-time research assistants of Academia Sinica?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the qualifications to apply for this program are indeed limited to those who are full-time research assistants or full-time research assistants or above of Academia Sinica.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Innovative Instrument Development Project
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Can a program last up to five years?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the program can last up to five years.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrumentation projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: As the program nears its end, you can apply early for the next program, right?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, when the plan is about to end and there is still one year left, you can apply for the next plan.
