Hospital-wide core facilities.title: High Field MRI Center
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Can I go to the high field MRI center to operate the equipment myself?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, you can choose to operate it yourself or let the facility staff test it on your behalf. However, you must first familiarize yourself with the use rules and charging standards of the center, and then contact the administrator Zhang Qifeng to research technicians. For details, please check the official website https://www.nmr.sinica.edu.tw/.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: High Field MRI Center
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who are the main service targets of the High Magnetic Field NMR Center?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main service objects of the High Magnetic Field NMR Center include researchers from Academia Sinica, domestic universities and other academic research institutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: High Field MRI Center
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: In what fields is NMR technology used?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: NMR technology is mainly used in the identification of small molecule structures, as well as the study of gene bodies and drug structures.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: High Field MRI Center
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What services can I get from a high field MRI center?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer:
You can get the following services from the High Field MRI Center:
1. Self-operated or tested by facility personnel.
2. Small molecule profiling test.
3. Substitute measurement of macromolecular atlas.
4. NMR fragment screening.
5. Obtain customized services in a cooperative mode, including experimental design, data analysis, structural calculation or result analysis and interpretation, etc.
In addition, they also provide technical consulting services related to nuclear magnetic resonance.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: High Field MRI Center
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main equipment in the high magnetic field nuclear magnetic resonance center?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main equipment of the high magnetic field nuclear magnetic resonance center includes 1 set of 500MHz nuclear magnetic resonance apparatus (including cryogenic probe), 3 sets of 600MHz nuclear magnetic resonance apparatus (including 2 sets of low temperature probe), 1 set of 800MHz nuclear magnetic resonance apparatus (including cryogenic probe) and 850MHz nuclear magnetic resonance instrument Instrument 1 group (including cryogenic probe). In addition, they also provide technical consulting services related to nuclear magnetic resonance.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: High Field MRI Center
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How to request technical advice from the High Magnetic Field MRI Center?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: You can go to the official website of the High Magnetic Field Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Center https://www.nmr.sinica.edu.tw/ to view relevant information, which should provide contact information, and you can ask them for technical advice through the contact information. In addition, this center is located in the NMR laboratory on the second floor of the Institute of Biomedical Sciences, Academia Sinica, and is managed by research technician Zhang Qifeng. You can also contact her directly for technical consultation.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: High Field MRI Center
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where is the High Field MRI Center located?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The high magnetic field nuclear magnetic resonance center is located in the NMR laboratory on the second floor of the Institute of Biomedical Sciences, Academia Sinica.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: High Field MRI Center
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How do I get in touch if I need to use the facilities of the High Field MRI Center?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you need to use the facilities of the High Magnetic Field NMR Center, you can refer to their official website: https://www.nmr.sinica.edu.tw/. Here you can find usage rules, charging standards and contact information.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Integrated core facility for protein structure and function analysis
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who is this integrated protein structure and function analysis core facility for?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This integrated protein structure and function analysis core facility is mainly provided to researchers of Academia Sinica, domestic universities and other academic research institutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Integrated core facility for protein structure and function analysis
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main steps in protein crystal structure analysis?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main steps in protein crystal structure analysis include: preparing protein crystals, collecting X-ray diffraction data, data calculation, solving phase problems, obtaining electron density maps, and establishing molecular structure models.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Integrated core facility for protein structure and function analysis
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main service projects that can be provided?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main service items are as follows: 1. Basic services, such as automatic point crystal screening, crystallization condition optimization, X-ray diffraction data collection, protein structure determination and verification, etc.; 2. Protein quality analysis package services, including protein analysis temperature adaptability, pH value adaptability and the presence or absence of disulfide bonds and other physical and chemical properties; 3. Integrated services, one-stop service from purified protein to crystal structure verification; 4. Using single crystal X-ray diffraction technology 5. Provide users with complete protein structure and function characterization information, as well as related technical consultation.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Integrated core facility for protein structure and function analysis
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What physicochemical properties are analyzed by the protein quality analysis package?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The protein quality analysis package service will analyze the physicochemical properties of the protein such as temperature adaptability, pH value adaptability and the presence or absence of disulfide bonds.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Integrated core facility for protein structure and function analysis
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What processes does integrated service include?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Integrated services include one-stop services from purified proteins to crystal structure verification.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Integrated core facility for protein structure and function analysis
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the major pieces of equipment in this core facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main equipment of this core facility are: 1. Protein QC Basic Package, 2. Protein QC Deluxe Package, 3. Particle size sieve chromatography multi-angle scattering analysis system (Protein QC QC SEC-MALS only), 4. Asymmetric flow field flow system (AF4-MALS), 5. Analytical SEC column (Analytical SEC column), 6. Circular dichroism spectrometer (CD J815), 7. Quantitative real-time polymerization chain reaction instrument (LightCycler 480 II), and 8. Ultraviolet-visible light spectrophotometer (UV/VIS V630 Bio).

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Integrated core facility for protein structure and function analysis
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where is this facility located and who is in charge of it?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This facility is located in Room 401, 4th Floor, Institute of Biochemistry, Academia Sinica, and is managed by Researcher Xu Shangde.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Integrated core facility for protein structure and function analysis
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How to inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of this core facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of this core facility, you can refer to this website: http://aspc.ibc.sinica.edu.tw/index.php.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Small Molecule Structure Identification Mass Spectrometry Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What types of compounds can this Small Molecule Structure Elucidation Mass Spectrometry Core Facility help us identify?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This Small Molecule Structure Elucidation Mass Spectrometry Core Facility helps us identify a wide range of organic or inorganic compounds, including chemical synthesis, natural products and metabolites.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Small Molecule Structure Identification Mass Spectrometry Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How does this core facility perform high-low resolution testing and map analysis?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This core facility uses several different types of mass spectrometers for high and low resolution testing and spectral interpretation. It mainly conducts accurate molecular weight measurement of various organic or inorganic compounds, such as chemical synthesis, natural products and metabolites, so as to assist researchers in identifying the molecular structure of compounds and related quantitative analysis.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Small Molecule Structure Identification Mass Spectrometry Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: When using this service, can you provide quantitative analysis services?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, this service can provide quantitative analysis.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Small Molecule Structure Identification Mass Spectrometry Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How is the technical consulting service for mass spectrometry analysis of organic or inorganic compounds carried out?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Organic or inorganic compound mass spectrometry technical consulting services are mainly to provide researchers with professional opinions and suggestions, from selecting the appropriate type of mass spectrometer to interpreting the analysis results. This is part of the overall core facility project to help researchers perform chemical analysis and solve related problems by providing professional guidance and technical support.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Small Molecule Structure Identification Mass Spectrometry Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What is the difference between a liquid chromatography electrospray mass spectrometer and a high-resolution magnetic field mass spectrometer?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Liquid chromatography electrospray mass spectrometer and high resolution magnetic field mass spectrometer are two different types of mass spectrometers. The liquid chromatography electrospray method flight mass spectrometer mainly uses the electrospray method to ionize the sample, and uses the principle of time-of-flight for mass analysis; while the high-resolution magnetic field mass spectrometer uses the magnetic field force to perform high-resolution ionization of sample ions. quality analysis. These two mass spectrometers have their own characteristics in application scope and analytical performance due to their different design principles and analysis methods.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Small Molecule Structure Identification Mass Spectrometry Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How do I apply and make an appointment if we want to use the facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to use the small molecule structure identification mass spectrometry core facility, you can refer to their website http://140.109.88.72/mass/, which has relevant usage rules, charging standards and contact information. It is usually necessary to apply first, and then make an appointment to use the equipment. If in doubt, you can contact Zengmei County Research Technician directly.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Small Molecule Structure Identification Mass Spectrometry Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the usage rules and charging standards of the small molecule structure elucidation mass spectrometry core facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to know the usage rules and charging standards of the mass spectrometry core facility for small molecule structure identification, you can refer to this website: http://140.109.88.72/mass/. Here you can find relevant information.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Small Molecule Structure Identification Mass Spectrometry Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who can I contact if I have a problem or need support?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you have questions or need assistance, you can contact the Zengmei County Research Technician, who manages the mass spectrometry core facility.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Small Molecule Structure Identification Mass Spectrometry Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How does this core facility assist researchers in mass spectrometry data analysis?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The core facility is to provide multiple different types of mass spectrometers for mass spectrometry analysis of various organic or inorganic compounds, including low-resolution and high-resolution mass spectrometry, and corresponding to various samples such as chemical synthesis, natural products and metabolites. These mass spectrometers help researchers accurately measure molecular weight, identify the molecular structure of compounds, and provide related quantitative analysis services. In addition, the core facility also provides technical consulting and customized mass spectrometry data analysis services.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Small Molecule Structure Identification Mass Spectrometry Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: .What steps are included in the custom service from sample preparation to mass spectrometry data analysis?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The customized service covers the whole process from sample preparation to mass spectrometry data analysis.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Adeno-Associated Virus Vector Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What does this adeno-associated virus vector core facility do?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The Adeno-Associated Virus Vector Core Facility is a special laboratory of the Institute of Biomedical Sciences, Academia Sinica. They are mainly committed to the preparation of adenovirus vectors. The research team has developed an efficient adenovirus preparation method to improve the success rate of encapsulating adenovirus vectors and achieve a large number of replications. Their purpose is to provide domestic laboratories with high-quality and affordable custom-made AAV strains. Provide a variety of services including adenovirus vector packaging, large-scale virus replication, etc., to support scientific research.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Adeno-Associated Virus Vector Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the characteristics and applications of adenoviral vectors?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Adenoviral vector is a commonly used gene transfection tool, which has many characteristics of gene delivery. It can be widely used in cell experiments and animal experiments, and can effectively infect cells in different organs. Adenoviral vectors can regulate the level of gene expression and will not be embedded in cell chromosomes, so they will not change the chromosome structure. Furthermore, it can simultaneously infect multiple different genes with different expression timeframes.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Adeno-Associated Virus Vector Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Which customers does this core facility mainly serve?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This core facility mainly provides services for researchers of Academia Sinica, domestic universities and other academic research institutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Adeno-Associated Virus Vector Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Can I go to them if I want to customize an AAV strain?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, you can go to the AAV Vector Core Facility for custom AAV strains. They have over 20 years experience in providing high quality and affordable custom AAV strain services.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Adeno-Associated Virus Vector Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Which of the offered services can help me replicate adenovirus?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Both heavily replicating viruses and relatively low replicating viruses can help you replicate adenoviruses. Large-scale adenovirus replication can obtain sufficient virus volume for subsequent experiments, and relatively small-scale adenovirus replication can meet the needs of smaller quantities.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Adeno-Associated Virus Vector Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How to design a plasmid that meets the needs? Do they offer consulting services?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To design a plasmid that fits your needs, consult with experts at the AAV Core Facility. They do offer adeno-associated virus plasmid construction design consulting services that can help clients design plasmids that fit their research needs.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Adeno-Associated Virus Vector Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where can I inquire about usage rules, charging standards and contact information?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To inquire about usage rules, charging standards and contact information, you can go to this website: https://www.ibms.sinica.edu.tw/aav/index.html.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Big Data Analysis and Scientific Computing Core Facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How does this big data analysis and scientific computing core facility help the research team improve research efficiency?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This core facility integrates the computing resources of multiple research institutes of Academia Sinica, provides computing services and data storage services, and helps research teams carry out big data analysis and scientific computing. It provides high-performance computing technology and a variety of service projects, allowing users to choose suitable computing services according to their needs. It also assists in problem-solving and workflow optimization to improve research productivity.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Beso STEM Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What kind of services does Beso's tomography core facility mainly provide?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Beso's tomography core facility mainly provides permeabilization fluorescence scanning services for large tissue samples. The professional technology here allows the excitation light to penetrate deep into the tissue, combined with Beso's layered light microscope technology for three-dimensional scanning, allowing users to capture whole-brain/whole-organ fluorescence microscopic images. In order to better process these high-resolution images, the facility continues to study and improve the data processing process.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Beso STEM Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who is this facility open to?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This facility is mainly open to researchers at Academia Sinica, domestic universities and other academic research institutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Beso STEM Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: In terms of image processing and data analysis, what new dimensions and high-resolution whole-organ fluorescence microscopy images can this facility provide?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This facility can perform three-dimensional scanning of complete mouse brains or organs and tissues of similar size through Besso's tomographic light microscopy technology, providing users with fluorescent microscopic image capture of whole brains or whole organs. Such high-resolution whole-brain images are difficult to achieve with traditional microscopes. In order to meet the challenges of image processing and data analysis, the facility will continue to develop technologies for processing large volumes of images and optimize the data processing process.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Beso STEM Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What is the difference between BLX-2 Beso layer light microscope and Zeiss Lightsheet Z.1?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Sorry, according to the provided text description, there is no detailed description of the difference between the BLX-2 Besso lightsheet microscope and the Zeiss Lightsheet Z.1, both of which are used for the acquisition and scanning of tomography images. If you need to know more about the differences, it is recommended to inquire about the relevant information or contact the management personnel of the facility.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Beso STEM Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What can we achieve through tissue sample permeabilization equipment?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Through tissue sample permeabilization equipment, we can make tissue samples better accept the scanning of optical microscopic images, so that the excitation light can penetrate deep into the tissue.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Beso STEM Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where is the Besso STEM Core Facility located?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The core facility of Beso's tomographic microscope is located in Room B608 on the 6th floor of the Interdisciplinary Science and Technology Research Building of Academia Sinica.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Beso STEM Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: If we want to use this core facility, what usage rules and charging standards do we need to know?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to use this core facility, you can check their official website https://cbcgroup1.wixsite.com/lightsheetcore, which has detailed information on usage rules and charging standards.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Beso STEM Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who do I contact with any questions, or where can I find relevant contact information?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To contact relevant personnel, you can find Associate Researcher Chen Bizhang of the Applied Science Research Center. For the rules of use, charging standards and contact information of the core facilities of the Beso layer light microscope, you can refer to this website: https://cbcgroup1.wixsite.com/lightsheetcore.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Data Science Statistics Cooperative
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who does the Academia Sinica Data Science and Statistics Cooperative mainly serve?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The Academia Sinica Data Science Statistics Cooperative mainly provides services for the researchers of the Academia Sinica, domestic universities, other academic research institutions and those who need statistics in the industry.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Data Science Statistics Cooperative
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What does the Data Science Statistics Cooperative offer?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main service items of the Data Science and Statistics Cooperative include: 1. Statistical method consultation and experimental design; 2. Statistical data pre-processing; 3. Data analysis, data analysis of various statistics and data science and technology; 4. Statistics Analysis and integration services, providing comprehensive statistical analysis solutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Data Science Statistics Cooperative
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How to ensure the accuracy and usability of data analysis?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To ensure the accuracy and usability of data analysis, we will perform data cleaning, data conversion and data integration in the data pre-processing stage to ensure data quality. This can make subsequent data analysis more accurate and valuable.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Data Science Statistics Cooperative
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What statistical analysis technical support can be provided?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: We can provide various statistical analysis technical support, such as descriptive statistical analysis, inferential statistical analysis and machine learning, so that you can obtain valuable results and insights from the data.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Data Science Statistics Cooperative
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How do I contact the Data Science Statistics Cooperative if I want to use their services?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to use the services of Data Science Statistics Cooperative, you can refer to their official website http://disc.stat.sinica.edu.tw/, where you can find usage rules, charging standards and contact information. I wish you a happy use!

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Data Science Statistics Cooperative
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where is the Data Science Statistical Cooperative primarily serving?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The Data Science and Statistics Cooperative mainly provides services in Room 401, Building of the Institute of Statistical Science, Academia Sinica.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Data Science Statistics Cooperative
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the co-op's fees?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: For the fee standard of cooperatives, you can refer to their official website: http://disc.stat.sinica.edu.tw/. Information about fees and other relevant regulations can be found there.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Glycoscience Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: When was the Glycoscience Core Facility established?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The Glycoscience Core Facility is due to open in 2023.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Glycoscience Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: For which institutions does this core facility mainly provide one-stop sugar analysis services?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This core facility mainly provides one-stop sugar analysis services for researchers of Academia Sinica, domestic universities and other academic research institutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Glycoscience Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main service items of this core facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main service items of this core facility include mass spectrometry sugar analysis, sugar chip analysis, lectin receptor platform and lectin chip platform.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Glycoscience Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the major instruments and equipment in this facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This facility has many major instruments and equipment, including Thermo PolarisQ mass spectrometer, Thermo LTQ-FT Ultra mass spectrometer, Thermo Orbitrap Fusion mass spectrometer, Bruker MALDI-TOF UltraFlexII mass spectrometer, Waters Cyclic IMS mass spectrometer, 4000QTrap mass spectrometer, wafer scanning Machine GenePixR4300A, ion chromatography with pulsed amperometric detector Dionex HPAEC-PAD, extreme performance liquid chromatography with fluorescence detector Waters Acquity UPLC H-class and lectin chip analyzer GlycoTechnica GlycoStation Reader. These instruments and equipment can meet the needs of various sugar analysis and provide a complete sugar analysis platform.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Glycoscience Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where are the laboratories at the Glycoscience Core Facility located?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The laboratories of the Glycoscience Core Facility are located in the 2L12, 7L08, and 8L02 laboratories of the Genome Research Center of the Academia Sinica, and the R402 laboratory of the Institute of Biochemistry.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Glycoscience Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who is in charge of this facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Xu Cuiling, a research associate technician, manages the facility.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Glycoscience Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How can I inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of the Glycoscience Core Facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of the Glycoscience Core Facility, you can go to this website: https://sites.google.com/view/glycoascore.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Glycoscience Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What happens if the core facility is unable to provide the required analytical services?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If the core facilities are unable to provide the required analysis services, they will be referred to other sugar analysis facilities inside and outside the hospital to provide a complete sugar analysis solution.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Glycoscience Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What is the difference between mass spectrometry sugar analysis and sugar wafer analysis?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Mass spectrometry sugar analysis mainly uses mass spectrometers to analyze the composition of glycans, glycolipids, glycoproteins, and monosaccharides, while sugar chip analysis uses chips with fixed sugar arrays to analyze sugars. Both are methods of sugar analysis but differ in the techniques and instruments used.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Glycoscience Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: . What are the Lectin Receptor Platform and the Lectin Chip Platform?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The Lectin Receptor Platform provides customized lectin receptor protein combinations for specific lectin analysis. The lectin chip platform provides a customized array combination chip, which can be customized for the analysis of plant lectins or human galectins.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Inflammatory Response Core System Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What services does this inflammatory response core system facility mainly provide?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer:
The Inflammatory Response Core Systems facility provides four main categories of services:
1. Multiple detection system: used to measure the expression of inflammatory factors in patient samples, and can measure multiple indicators at the same time.
2. Immunohistochemical staining: to help analyze immune cells in a specimen, detect and visualize the expression of specific proteins in tissue samples.
3. Establishment of mouse skin disease models: Assist cooperative laboratories to establish models of mice such as contact dermatitis, atopic dermatitis, and psoriasis to study related inflammatory responses.
4. Analysis of sugar-binding proteins: Provide related services for the analysis of sugar-binding proteins, which play an important role in inflammatory responses.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Inflammatory Response Core System Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Which of the mouse models supported by this core facility are suitable for studying human autoimmune and inflammatory diseases?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This core facility provides mouse models suitable for the study of human autoimmune and inflammatory diseases. These include mice with models of skin diseases such as contact dermatitis, atopic dermatitis and psoriasis.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Inflammatory Response Core System Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What is the multi-detection system used for?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The multi-detection system is mainly used to measure the expression of inflammatory factors in patient samples, and it can measure multiple indicators at the same time.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Inflammatory Response Core System Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What information can immunohistochemical staining help us understand?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Immunohistochemical staining can help us detect and visualize immune cells in a specimen, as well as the expression of specific proteins in tissue samples. This technique facilitates the analysis of immune responses and inflammatory processes.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Inflammatory Response Core System Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Among the main equipment, the suspension array magnetic bead washing system is used to help sample processing, right?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, the suspension array magnetic bead washing system is mainly used to help process and separate samples in preparation for subsequent analysis.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Inflammatory Response Core System Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where can I find the rules and fees for using the facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The usage rules and charging standards of the facilities can be found at this website: http://www.ibms.sinica.edu.tw/inflammation_core_facility/index.html

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Inflammatory Response Core System Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: If I want to use this core facility, how can I contact the administrator, Chen Huanyuan, Research Assistant Technician?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to use this core facility, you can refer to this website http://www.ibms.sinica.edu.tw/inflammation_core_facility/index.html, which contains detailed information about usage rules, charging standards and contact information. Through this channel, you can contact the administrator, Chen Huanyuan, the research associate technician.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What kind of materials does this X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory mainly study?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory mainly studies the physical and chemical properties of solid crystal materials, powder crystals and thin film materials.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: If I am a researcher at a domestic university, can I also use the facilities of this laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, as a researcher at a domestic university, you can also use the facilities of this laboratory. The laboratory is not only open to researchers of Academia Sinica, but also to domestic universities and other academic research institutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What is the principle of X-ray diffractometer?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The principle of X-ray diffractometer is to use accelerated electrons to impact metal targets to generate X-rays, and then analyze samples with periodic lattice structures. By collecting the diffraction angles of different crystal planes, the lattice parameters of the sample can be analyzed, and by analyzing the diffraction intensity of each crystal plane, information on the type and position of atoms in the lattice structure can be obtained. So the combined diffraction pattern of each crystal is unique and, like a human fingerprint, can be used to identify a material as a mineral crystal or as a crystalline material.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: There are several X-ray diffractometers in this laboratory. How are their functions different?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: There are three different types of X-ray diffractometers in this laboratory. The first one is X-ray room temperature diffractometer, which is used for X-ray diffraction analysis at room temperature; the second one is X-ray variable temperature diffractometer, which has the function of changing temperature. , can conduct research on temperature dependence; the third is a high-resolution X-ray diffractometer, which can provide wide-angle and low-grazing angle diffraction analysis, and is specially used to analyze the microstructure of thin films.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What safety education and machine operation training are required before using the X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Before using the X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory, users need to receive relevant safety education and machine operation training, and only after passing the examination can they obtain the authority to use the facilities and instruments independently.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Which sample characteristics analysis services can this laboratory provide?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This laboratory can provide analysis services for the characteristics of sample crystal phase, material structure, material internal strain, material residual stress and material crystallinity.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What is the difference between X-ray variable temperature diffractometer and X-ray room temperature diffractometer?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main difference between X-ray variable temperature diffractometer and X-ray room temperature diffractometer is the temperature function. The X-ray variable temperature diffractometer has the function of changing temperature and can conduct temperature-dependent research, while the X-ray normal temperature diffractometer is only used for X-ray diffraction analysis at normal temperature.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What kind of samples are high-resolution X-ray diffractometers suitable for analyzing?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: High-resolution X-ray diffractometer is suitable for analyzing samples with thin film microstructure.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where is the X-ray Diffraction Materials Analysis Laboratory and who runs it?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory is located in the B1A laboratory on the first floor of the Institute of Physics, Academia Sinica, and is managed by Ou Minnan, a research assistant.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: X-ray diffraction material analysis laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: . Where should I go to inquire about the rules of use, charging standards and contact information of the X-ray Diffraction Material Analysis Laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To inquire about the rules of use, charging standards and contact information of the X-ray Diffraction Materials Analysis Laboratory, you can refer to this website: https://www.phys.sinica.edu.tw/~XRDCF/.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What kind of plan is the TIGP-X Pilot Program?
Scholarship.answer: TIGP-X Pilot Program is a program jointly cultivated by Academia Sinica and foreign universities to cultivate international doctoral students. Its purpose is to promote international academic cooperation, attract international students, and encourage Academia Sinica researchers to cooperate with foreign academic institutions. The program also provides grants to TIGP-X international doctoral students to conduct research at Academia Sinica during the dissertation research stage, so as to increase the talent pool of doctoral students.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Who can apply for this program?
Scholarship.answer: Only researchers who are assistant researchers or above in the institutes and centers of Academia Sinica can apply for this plan.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: How many admissions are planned for the TIGP-X Pilot Program?
Scholarship.answer: As the number of admissions must be matched with the vacancy of TIGP dormitories, it is currently impossible to specify the number of admissions.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What documents are required to apply for this program?
Scholarship.answer: To apply for this program, you need to prepare the following documents: cooperation plan or doctoral dissertation proposal, doctoral student’s personal application materials, recommendation letter from the supervisor of foreign cooperation unit, and letter of consent from the doctoral student’s school. Remember to review the application form in detail before applying!

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What is the application procedure for TIGP-X Pilot Program? How long will the review process take?
Scholarship.answer: The TIGP-X Pilot Program has preliminary review and review procedures. Applicants need to submit to their own research institute or center for preliminary review. Then, the applicant's research institute and center will send a letter to the International Office together with the initial review opinion (if there are more than two applications in the current period, a recommendation order must be provided). After that, the International Office will compile the application cases and send them to the Academic Consulting Association for review. The review time will take about 20 working days. Afterwards, the reexamination opinion will be reported together with the application documents to the president of Academia Sinica for approval. After the re-examination results are approved, the Academia Sinica will notify the research institutes and centers to which the researchers belong.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: When is the application deadline for the TIGP-X Pilot Program?
Scholarship.answer: There are three application echelons each year, and the initial review and review procedures will be carried out. Because applicants need to submit to their own research institute or center for preliminary review, the deadline for submitting applications to the research institute or center must be confirmed by the applicant to the research institute or center. Afterwards, the deadlines for the applicant's research institute and center to send the initial review opinion letter to the International Office are the end of February, the end of June, and the end of October, respectively.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: According to the date of doctoral students' research at the hospital, how should I choose the application level?
Scholarship.answer: The way to choose the application level is based on the estimated time for doctoral students to study in Academia Sinica. If it is expected to start research at Academia Sinica between April and July, the institute/center must submit an application before the end of February; if it is expected to start research at Academia Sinica between August and November, the institute/center Applications should be made before the end of June; finally, if the plan is to start research at Academia Sinica between December and March of the following year, the institute/center needs to make an application before the end of October.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: The application materials for the TIGP-X Pilot Program must be written in English, right?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the application materials for the TIGP-X Pilot Program must be written in English.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: How many letters of recommendation do I need?
Scholarship.answer: You need to prepare at least one recommendation letter in any form, remember to write it in English.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: How many TIGP-X doctoral students can the researchers of Academia Sinica receive at most each year?
Scholarship.answer: Academia Sinica researchers can receive a maximum of one TIGP-X doctoral student subsidy each year, so students should be selected carefully and limited to one case in the same echelon.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: If there is a time limit for the completion of the cooperative research project, should it be stated in the application?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, if there is a time limit for the completion of the cooperative research project, you need to explain it when you apply.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: The maximum application period for research cooperation in TIGP-X Pilot Program is 3 years, right?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the maximum application period for research cooperation is 3 years. Minimum 1 year.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: If you are selected, but due to special circumstances, TIGP-X doctoral students cannot come to Taiwan as planned, do you have to re-apply and review?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, if a TIGP-X doctoral student cannot come to Taiwan at the original time due to special circumstances, the co-advising professor at Academia Sinica needs to resubmit the application and accept the review.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What are the two types of TIGP-X Pilot Program awards?
Scholarship.answer: The TIGP-X Pilot Program has two types of grants. The first is "TIGP-X Academia Sinica Scholarship for International Doctoral Students". Basically, the Academia Sinica and the Academia Sinica researchers (applicants) will receive NT$34,000 each month and a scholarship of 16,000 yuan. If there are special circumstances, it can be raised at the time of application. The second type is "TIGP-X Academia Sinica International Doctoral Students". The scholarships received are provided by the researchers of Academia Sinica, and the amount must meet the relevant specifications of the "Academia Sinica Scholarship Funding Points". The selected doctoral students are collectively referred to as TIGP-X doctoral students.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Can TIGP-X doctoral students only get one subsidy for round-trip air tickets?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the round-trip air ticket for TIGP-X doctoral students can only be subsidized once.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: How to arrange the accommodation for TIGP-X doctoral students during their stay in Academia Sinica?
Scholarship.answer: During the research period of the selected TIGP-X doctoral students at Academia Sinica, Academia Sinica will arrange to live in the TIGP dormitory for the first year, and the expenses will be borne by the TIGP-X doctoral students themselves. From the second year onwards, researchers from the Academia Sinica who serve as co-advising professors will assist in renting houses outside the academy.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What kind of subsidies can researchers of Academia Sinica be selected for the program?
Scholarship.answer: Academia Sinica researchers of the selected program can apply to Academia Sinica to go abroad on business, and Academia Sinica will pay for an economy-class air ticket to and from Taiwan, and pay living expenses and office expenses (handling fees, insurance premiums) according to the "Overseas Travel Expense Reporting Points" . The air ticket money can only be used to participate in the selected TIGP-X doctoral student's thesis defense (Thesis Defense), or to visit the school of the TIGP-X doctoral student during the implementation period and discuss academic cooperation matters with their supervisors.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: After being selected as a TIGP-X doctoral student, can I continue to receive the scholarship from my research institution during my research?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, after being selected as a TIGP-X doctoral student, you can still continue to receive scholarships from your own research institution during your research at Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: The air ticket needs to be paid in advance, will it be refunded to our post office account later?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the air ticket for being selected as a TIGP-X doctoral student needs to be paid in advance, and then after coming to Taiwan, the payment will be refunded to your post office account after going through the verification process of Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Do visa and transportation expenses need to be borne by ourselves, without subsidies?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, TIGP-X doctoral students need to bear the visa and transportation expenses themselves, and Academia Sinica does not provide subsidies. However, Academia Sinica will assist you in handling visa-related matters with foreign embassies, and will also provide transportation information from the airport to the dormitory.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: When conducting thesis research at Academia Sinica, we still need to be responsible for the tuition fees of overseas schools, right?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, even when you are doing thesis research at Academia Sinica, you still need to be responsible for the tuition fees of overseas schools.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: How to submit the research progress report written every year to the bilateral advisors for approval?
Scholarship.answer: Each year you are required to write a research progress report, which is then submitted to your bilateral advisor for review. After passing the review, it will be handed over to the International Office for review by the Academic Advisory Council. After passing the review, you can get the scholarship for the next year.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Specifically, who is responsible for the guidance and assessment of TIGP-X doctoral students' research work at Academia Sinica?
Scholarship.answer: The assessment of TIGP-X doctoral student’s research work guidance in Academia Sinica is the responsibility of the applicant, that is, the student’s co-advising professor in Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: If TIGP-X doctoral students need to leave the country for more than a certain period of time, what will happen to the scholarship?
Scholarship.answer: If you need to leave the country for more than 2 weeks due to personal reasons, the suspension of scholarship days will be counted from the first day of departure, not two weeks after departure. So once you leave the country for more than 2 weeks, the scholarship will stop from the day you leave the country.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: When the results of my research at Academia Sinica involve intellectual property rights, what regulations do I need to abide by?
Scholarship.answer: When your achievements during your research at Academia Sinica involve intellectual property rights, you need to follow the "Academia Sinica Research and Development Achievements and Utilization Methods" to deal with them.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What should I do if I am involved in violation of academic ethics during my research?
Scholarship.answer: If you are involved in violations of academic ethics during the research period, it will be dealt with in accordance with the "Academia Sinica Ethics Committee Settings and Operation Points".

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Which foreign academic and research institutions can TIGP-X Pilot Program cooperate with?
Scholarship.answer: TIGP-X Pilot Program can cooperate with various foreign academic and research institutions, not limited to institutions that have signed an MOU with Academia Sinica. If the student's department needs to sign the MOU in response to this plan, the research institutes and centers where the researchers of the Academia Sinica belong can also sign the MOU. This program applies to the three academic areas of Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Which academic fields of Academia Sinica does this plan apply to?
Scholarship.answer: This plan is applicable to the three major academic fields of Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Does the TIGP-X Pilot Program have any restrictions on nationality?
Scholarship.answer: The TIGP-X Pilot Program basically has no restrictions on nationality. Doctoral students, whether native or foreign, can be nominated to apply. Taiwanese students who are studying in foreign universities' doctoral programs are also eligible. However, Hong Kong and Macao students need to leave the country once every six months, and cannot join the health insurance system, and their rights and interests are less than other foreign students. Students from mainland China will not be applicable until the "Regulations on the Permission for People from the Mainland Area to Enter the Taiwan Area" are revised. As for schools in mainland China, Hong Kong, and Macao, the Academia Sinica does not encourage them due to politically sensitive factors, but if the application is helpful to the joint research between the two parties, it can still be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Can students from Hong Kong and Macao participate in this program?
Scholarship.answer: Students from Hong Kong and Macao can participate in this plan, but they need to leave the country once every six months and cannot join the health insurance system. Compared with other foreign students, they have less rights and interests. In addition, when politically sensitive issues are involved, the Academia Sinica will conduct a review on a case-by-case basis.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Can students from Mainland China participate in the TIGP-X Pilot Program?
Scholarship.answer: Students from Mainland China are not currently eligible for the TIGP-X Pilot Program, and they need to wait for the "Regulations on Permitting People from the Mainland Area to Enter the Taiwan Area" to be relaxed and amended before they can apply.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Do applicants have to serve as co-advising professors?
Scholarship.answer: It is best for the applicant to serve as a co-supervising professor, but if some overseas universities/institutions cannot accept the co-supervising system due to strict regulations, the applicant can also strive to become a thesis committee member for doctoral students. This situation will be determined on a case-by-case basis, as long as it can be confirmed that there is a situation that promotes substantive cooperation between the two parties, it should be acceptable.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: If the applicant cannot serve as a co-advising professor, can he become a thesis committee member?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, if you cannot serve as a co-advising professor, you can try to become a thesis committee member. Individual cases will be considered during the review, as long as there are facts that promote substantive cooperation between the two parties, it should be acceptable.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Can applicants pay TIGP-X Ph.
Scholarship.answer: After asking the National Science Council, as long as the applicant has the fact that he actually supervises the doctoral students, he can use the award subsidy planned by the National Science Council to pay the doctoral students of TIGP-X, and the student status of the National Science Council award subsidy has no nationality limit.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What assistance will Academia Sinica provide after being selected as a TIGP-X doctoral student?
Scholarship.answer:
First of all, Academia Sinica will contact the foreign embassy where the selected TIGP-X doctoral students are located, and ask them to help with visa-related matters. Then, relevant information such as TIGP dormitory reservation and room payment will be provided for the first year. From the second year, the accommodation will be assisted by the co-advisor of Academia Sinica (that is, the applicant of this program) to rent a house outside the hospital. Next, the traffic reference information from Taiwan airport to TIGP dormitory will be provided. After entering the country, we will also assist in the verification of the air ticket payment.

After TIGP-X doctoral students enter the country, the institute/center to which the co-advising professor of Academia Sinica belongs will provide the following assistance: 1. Assist in the application process of changing the residence visa to ARC, and remind to update ARC every year. 2. Assist in applying for accident insurance after entry. 3. After staying in Taiwan for more than 183 days, they will assist in applying for health insurance, Confucianism and related matters. 4. Apply for a post office account.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: How to arrange accommodation for the selected TIGP-X doctoral students during their research?
Scholarship.answer: During the research period of the selected doctoral students in the institute, Academia Sinica will arrange to live in the TIGP dormitory in the first year, and from the second year, the co-advisor of Academia Sinica (that is, the applicant of this program) will assist in renting a house outside the institute.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What reports and research results do I need to submit after being selected as a TIGP-X doctoral student?
Scholarship.answer:
Students selected as "TIGP-X Academia Sinica Scholarship International Doctoral Students" are required to write a research progress report every year during their stay in Academia Sinica, and after being approved by the bilateral advisors, submit it to the International Office for review to obtain the next year's scholarship. In addition, within two weeks before the completion of the TIGP-X cooperative research project and the return to the place of student status, a complete written research report needs to be submitted for reference by the International Office.

Students who are selected as "TIGP-X Academia Sinica International Doctoral Students" only need to submit a complete written research report within two weeks before returning to the place of student status after the completion of the TIGP-X cooperative research project, for reference by the International Office .

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Do selected TIGP-X doctoral students need to report to the hospital within a certain period of time?
Scholarship.answer: Selected TIGP-X doctoral students should report to the hospital within the starting date of starting research in the hospital.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: When was TIIP established and what is its purpose?
Scholarship.answer: TIIP was established to provide young foreign scholars with internship opportunities, let them know more about Academia Sinica's international graduate program, and then improve their willingness to study.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Is the application period from January 1st to February 28th every year?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the annual application period is from January 1 to February 28.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Can I apply for this summer internship program online?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, you can apply for this summer internship program through the online system. The application period is from January 1 to February 28 each year.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: When applying, you need to choose three advisors. Is it based on your own research interests and academic experience?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, when applying, you need to choose three advisors in the application system according to your research interests and academic experience.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: The internship period is fixed for 2 months, divided into three echelons, right?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the internship period is fixed as two months, divided into three echelons: the first echelon is from May 1st to June 30th, the second echelon is from June 1st to July 31st, and the third echelon is 7 August 1st to August 31st.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Who can apply for this summer internship program?
Scholarship.answer: Those who can apply for this summer internship program are current students of foreign nationality, including final-year undergraduate students, current students of postgraduate master’s programs, and students above the fourth grade of the five-year bachelor’s and master’s double degree system. In addition, Those with a bachelor's or master's degree may also apply. But please note that those who have already participated in the TIGP summer internship program and doctoral students are not eligible for application

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Can I juggle other jobs during my internship?
Scholarship.answer: You cannot take care of other work during the internship. You must devote yourself to the internship and abide by the relevant regulations of Academia Sinica. Failure to comply may result in termination of the internship program.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Will the internship program be terminated if it violates relevant regulations or Taiwan laws?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the internship program will be terminated if you violate the relevant regulations or Taiwan laws.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What documents do I need to submit when applying for an internship program?
Scholarship.answer: When applying online for the internship program, you need to complete or submit the following documents: resume, study plan, and two letters of recommendation (automatically sent to recommenders through the application system, and they need to complete the letter of recommendation before February 28) , Upload the official transcript with the school stamp, and the English test transcript (optional).

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: When will the review results of the International Graduate Studies Summer Internship Program be announced?
Scholarship.answer: The review results will be announced on the International Graduate Program Summer Internship Program website in early April.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: How will interns know if they are accepted?
Scholarship.answer: Interns can check the review results on the website of the International Graduate Program Summer Internship Program in early April, after which the admitted students will receive an official letter of admission from the International Graduate Program.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Once admitted, what are the steps to be completed in the registration process?
Scholarship.answer: There are three steps to complete the registration procedure after admission, the first is to report to the laboratory with the instructor, the second is to find the course assistant to report and submit the air ticket certificate, and the last is to go to the International Office to find the person in charge of the summer internship program check in.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What kind of air ticket proof do I need to submit?
Scholarship.answer: You need to submit proof of air ticket, usually your original boarding pass, original ticket purchase certificate (original), flight itinerary and passport photocopy, and you can hand it in to the course assistant you belong to when you register.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Who do we need to report and keep in touch with during the internship?
Scholarship.answer: During the internship, you need to go to the laboratory to report to the instructor, then to the program assistant to report and hand in the air ticket certification documents, and finally to the International Office to report to the person in charge of the summer internship program of the international postgraduate program. Stay in touch with faculty advisors, program assistants, and program directors.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: How much is the monthly living expenses?
Scholarship.answer: The monthly living expenses are NT$30,000 (before tax), of which NT$20,000 is paid by the International Office, and NT$10,000 is paid by the instructor.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: How is air ticket subsidy calculated?
Scholarship.answer: The airfare allowance is such that the airfare will only be refunded upon successful completion of the internship. (Please compare the prices of different websites before purchasing the air ticket.) If you will return to your country after the internship, the International Office will subsidize half of the cost of your round-trip economy class air ticket (up to NT$15,000). If you do not return to China for some reason after the internship, such as being officially admitted to the TIGP program, they will only subsidize your one-way economy class air ticket to Taiwan. To apply for airfare credit, you will need to submit your original proof of purchase (original), original boarding pass, flight itinerary and a copy of your passport. The refund amount of air ticket fee will be in accordance with the regulations of Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What documents do I need to prepare to apply for air ticket subsidy?
Scholarship.answer: To apply for air ticket subsidy, you need to prepare four documents: original ticket purchase certificate (original), original boarding pass, flight itinerary and passport photocopy.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What is TIIP abbreviation?
Scholarship.answer: TIIP is the abbreviation of "Taiwan International Internship Program", which is the Taiwan International Internship Program.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: If I choose the advisor of Academia Sinica, will the International Office arrange accommodation?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, if you choose the advisor of Academia Sinica, the International Office will assist you in arranging accommodation.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: How much do you need to pay per month for a double room with bunk beds?
Scholarship.answer: A double room with bunk beds costs NT$4,000 per month.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: If I choose an advisor at a partner university, do I need to find accommodation myself?
Scholarship.answer: If you choose the instructor of the partner university, you can ask the instructor to help arrange accommodation during the internship.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Is travel insurance a must? How much does it cost?
Scholarship.answer: Yes. Travel insurance is required during your stay in Taiwan. Regardless of whether the intern has purchased travel insurance in his or her own country, the International Office will assist the intern to purchase basic travel insurance when they arrive in Taiwan. This is mandatory. Otherwise, interns will not be able to work in the laboratory, but the specific expenses will be borne by you.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Is this TIIP summer internship program for international graduate students?
Scholarship.answer: The purpose of TIIP is to provide young foreign scholars with internship opportunities and to enhance their understanding of Academia Sinica and Academia Sinica’s international graduate programs. We welcome interested foreign students to come to Academia Sinica for internships.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Are there specific formatting requirements for posters reporting on internship outcomes?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the International Office will provide a poster format for the interns to refer to during the internship. Interns are required to make posters and present the results of the internship in oral presentations. Poster presentations will be held at the end of June, July and August. In addition, interns should also remember to fill out the internship program questionnaire before the end of the internship.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What is the purpose of filling out the internship program questionnaire?
Scholarship.answer: The purpose of filling out the internship program questionnaire is to let the interns share their views on the internship experience, help the sponsor understand the internship results and collect suggestions for improvement.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Do I need to complete all the questionnaires and poster reports before the end of the internship?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, before the end of the internship, you have to complete the questionnaire, make a poster and give an oral report. Poster presentations will be held at the end of June, July and August.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: When is the Orientation for New Students for the Summer Internship Program held?
Scholarship.answer: Orientation sessions for new students will be held in early May, early June and early July.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Can I choose to take Chinese classes between June and July?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the International Office will arrange a Chinese class for beginners in June and July. You can choose one of the months to attend, but remember to seek the consent of the instructor first.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Do I need to confirm with the instructor in advance for Chinese class?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, interns who want to participate in the Chinese class must first confirm with the instructor, and they can only participate after obtaining approval.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What specific learning content does the elementary Chinese class have?
Scholarship.answer: The main purpose of the elementary Chinese class is to enable interns to increase their interest in Chinese learning and experience Chinese culture. So I will teach some basic Chinese conversation and introduce relevant cultural content.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Participating in the summer internship program will let me know more about the TIGP-X Pilot Program, right?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, to participate in the summer internship program, the International Office will arrange for you to attend the freshman briefing, so that you can learn more about Academia Sinica, the international graduate program and the TIGP-X Pilot Program.
